Name: Sandipan
Content:
Whenever I see a #100DaysOfCode post on my feed, I show my support with likes & comments – whether I know that person or not.

No expectations - just want to appreciate their dedication.

I encourage you to do the same. Let's support and celebrate each other's coding journey

Name: Oscar Bastos
Content:
Working with JavaScript dates has always been a headache But there's  an alternative in ES2024. 

The Temporal API is designed to make handling dates/times easier, with tools to simplify creating, modifying, and formatting dates and durations.  #Javascript #100DaysOfCode

Content: Mastering JavaScript Debugging: Tips for Efficient Code Troubleshooting  Use console.log() to print and debug. Check the browser console for errors. Comment out code to isolate issues. Set breakpoints in developer tools. Debug in small increments.

Content:
Object Fit - CSS

Let's image we have a rectangle image and we want to display it in a square container in our UI. If we don't apply any CSS property, then the image will loose its aspect ratio and will look strange. But there is a CSS property called object-fit that

Content:
Want to become a better front-end developer?

Join https://iCodeThis.com It's free! You get a new coding challenge daily. Takes ~20-60 mins to complete.

Do it for at least 30 days and I'll promise you'll see great results!

Dozens of developers did it and so can you!

Name: 𝕔𝕓𝕞
Content:
Don’t rush it. 

Learn the fundamentals and get comfortable first. 

Get some projects under your belt. 

Read mdn docs, blogs, stack overflow, or any resources to find ways to solve problems. 

Don’t just copy and paste code if you don’t know how it works.  

My two cents.
